app module

app.add_mod()

Add a new moderator.

This endpoint allows the addition of a new moderator by providing a username and password.

Returns:

JSON response containing moderator details or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.delete_article(id)

Delete an article.

This endpoint allows the deletion of an article by specifying its ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the article to be deleted.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.delete_file(filename)

Delete an uploaded file.

This endpoint allows the deletion of an uploaded file by specifying its filename.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the file to be deleted.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.delete_mod(id)

Delete a moderator.

This endpoint allows the deletion of a moderator by specifying their user ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the moderator to be deleted.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.download_file(filename)

Download a file.

This endpoint allows users to download a previously uploaded file.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Name of the file to be downloaded.

Returns:

The file to be downloaded.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.get_favoris_user(id)

Get favorited articles for a user.

This endpoint retrieves the list of articles favorited by a user by specifying their user ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the user.

Returns:

JSON response containing a list of favorited articles or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.get_mod(id)

Get a specific moderator.

This endpoint retrieves details of a specific moderator by specifying their user ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the moderator to be retrieved.

Returns:

JSON response containing moderator details or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.get_mods()

Get all moderators.

This endpoint retrieves a list of all moderators.

Returns:

JSON response containing a list of moderators or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.like_article()

Like an article.

This endpoint allows a user to like an article by providing their user ID and the article ID.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.login()

Authenticate and login a user.

This endpoint allows users to login by providing a username and password.

Returns:

JSON response containing user details or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.logout()

Logout the current user.

This endpoint logs out the user by unsetting JWT cookies.

Returns:

JSON response indicating successful logout.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.modify_mod()

Modify a moderator.

This endpoint allows the modification of a moderator’s details by specifying their user ID, and providing the updated username and/or password.

Returns:

JSON response containing updated moderator details or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.refresh_expiring_jwts(response)

Refresh expiring JWTs.

This function intercepts responses and refreshes expiring JWTs by extending their validity.

Parameters:

response (flask.Response) – The Flask response object.

Returns:

The modified response.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.register()

Register a new user.

This endpoint allows users to register by providing a username, password, and role.

Returns:

JSON response containing user details or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.unlike_article(user_id, article_id)

Unlike an article.

This endpoint allows a user to unlike an article by specifying their user ID and the article ID.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – The ID of the user.

  • article_id (int) – The ID of the article.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response

app.upload_file()

Upload a file.

This endpoint allows users to upload a PDF file.

Returns:

JSON response indicating success or an error message.

Return type:

flask.Response
